greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Prime islands: for n >= 2, a(n) = least prime whose adjacent primes are exactly 2n apart; a(1) = 3 by convention.
comment: For n > 1: (n) = A000040(A261525(n)+1) for n > 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 23 2015
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..100
Abhimanyu Kumar and Anuraag Saxena, Insulated primes, arXiv:2011.14210 [math.NT], 2020. Mentions this sequence.
example: 29 is in a sea of 6 composites, namely 24, 25, 26, 27, 28 and 30 and is the smallest such number, so a(4) = 29.
xref: Another version: see A098968 and A098969.
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_ and _David W. Wilson_
ext: Typo in example fixed by _Zak Seidov_, Jan 25 2015
